oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Harlan Howard
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Harlan Howard (song writer). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Harlan Howard; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Rick Phillips introducing Harlan Howard -- (00:41) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:30) D. A. promotions commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host and Phillips -- (02:41) Pick Me Up on Your Way Down (Charlie Walker) -- (03:41) Phillips and Howard discuss how Howard had cut some songs, although he is known exclusively as a song-writer -- (07:53) Heart Aches by the Number (Ray Price) -- (10:49) Phillips performs an Army parachute modification radio spot -- (11:46) The Keys in the Mailbox (Freddie Hart) -- (14:33) Soldier's Magazine radio spot performed by an unidentified host -- (15:41) I Fall to Pieces (Patsy Cline) -- (18:19) Phillips invites Howard to reflect on how he met a producer who connected his song with Patsy Cline -- (22:10) Your Heart Turned Left (And I Was Right) (George Jones) -- (24:22) Servicemen's Opportunity College radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (25:43) The Blizzard (Jim Reeves) -- (28:57) Keys to Quality commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (29:29) She Called Me Baby (Charlie Rich) -- (31:52) Phillips asks Howard to reflect on ""She Called Me Baby"" and ""Life Turned Her That Way"" -- (36:04) Life Turned Her That Way (Mel Tillis) -- (38:21) Anti-smoking commercial spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (39:28) Foolin' Around (Buck Owens) -- (41:54) Car pooling commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (42:44) She's a Little Bit Country (George Hamilton IV) -- (45:09) Phillips praises ""She's a Little Bit Country"" and Howard reveals it was written for his wife; additionally, both discuss ""No Charge"" -- (48:38) No Charge (Melba Montgomery) -- (51:47) Phillips asks Howard what he can share about being a song-writer, and both say their goodbyes -- (53:00) Phillips performs a Hosing Referral Office commercial spot -- (53:35) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:42) Phillips introduces next week's guest: Tanya Tucker -- (55:49) Would You Lay With Me in a Field of Stone (Tanya Tucker) -- (58:08) Tucker reflects on how she places feeling into ""Would You Lay With Me in a Field of Stone"" -- (59:43) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Howard, Harlan; Phillips, Rick;
